content.description: Climb a blocky dyke with three bolts up to a crack and step right onto a ledge. Belay with gear here or step up to the next ledge with belay bolts. The first clip is a bouldery 15' up. Variation: continue on the dyke past one more bolt to the top. Decent: rap the route (this is the main descent from the summit of North Breezeway Dome).
content.protection: Three to four bolts, cams to 2".
content.location: Hike through The Breezeway and turn right, the climb is on the west face of North Breezeway Dome 30 feet north the south corner.

climbs.name: Three Dicks in the Wilderness
climbs.fa: Dan Briley, Mark Quinn, Jon Deboer

content.description: Climb past two bolts (crux) onto a shallow ramp for a couple of feet then up the dyke past three more bolts and some TCU placements. Belay from two bolts and rap the route to descend.
content.location: On the northeast corner of North Breezeway Dome. Approach around the north end of Hawk Rock.

climbs.name: Scurvy by Nature
climbs.fa: Dan Briley, Dustin Wilikinson, Mark Quinn

content.description: Stand up past a horizontal crack to a bolt to another horizontal crack to another bolt to the top. Belay with gear on this ledge or place a directional and go one more step up to belay at the anchors of Vertical Valium. Rappel from here.
content.location: At the mouth of the Breezeway on the southwest corner of North Breezeway Dome.

climbs.name: Respectfully Cavaliered
climbs.fa: TR- "Waterman" Robert Conz & "Rock-n-Roll" Tom Ray early 90s, First lead- Dustin Wilkinson & Dan Briley 2006

content.description: Same start as Dustin the Wind. Face climb past a bolt to a small stance with TCU placements then up the shallow outside corner past more bolts to a crack. Continue up and right past the crack to a seam below a dyke, then follow the dyke through the head wall. Bring a #2 or #3 cam to protect the last moves or run it out to a two bolt belay. To descend, go to the rap station on the west side at the top of Vertical Valium then follow the Breezeway back to the base.
content.location: Start from the lowest point on the east face.

climbs.name: My Ex
climbs.fa: Dan Briley, Mark Quinn, Jon Deboer

content.description: Climb a small dyke until it ends then friction right, past the large dyke, and finish on the left of two right leaning cracks. Belay with gear or go a few more feet to the belay/rappel station on Three Dicks on a Dyke.
content.protection: Three bolts, cams- TCUs up to 3".
content.location: Approach around the north end of Hawk Rock to the northeast corner of North Breezeway Dome.

climbs.name: Luckily Irish
climbs.fa: Dan Briley, Dustin Wilkinson- St Patricks Day 2006

content.description: Climb easy face to a bulge 20' off the ground. Balance over the bulge (crux) then up more easy face to finish on discontinuous right leaning cracks on the head wall. Belay with gear. To descend, go to the rap station on the west side at the top of Vertical Valium then follow the Breezeway back to the base.
content.location: Just left of Highlander Roof under orange streaks in the head wall.

climbs.name: Johnny Went Home
climbs.fa: Dan Briley, Danny Urioste, Killis Howard, Joel Adams

content.description: Four bolts protect the face, 5.9, up to a tiny dihedral that leads to the ledge at the top of the first pitch of Highlander Roof. Continue on Highlander Roof through the wide crack, 5.8, to the top of the dome. Belay with gear. To descend, 1) go 40' to the north end of the dome and rappel from the belay station of Three Dicks on a Dyke back down the east side (you might need a leaver sling), or 2) go to the rap station on the west side at the top of Vertical Valium then follow the Breezeway back to the base.
content.protection: Four bolts, Cams- TCUs up to 4".
content.location: To reach this, hike/scramble around the north end of Hawk Rock and then back south to the end of the corridor formed between Hawk Rock and North Breezeway Dome.

climbs.name: Last Call
climbs.fa: Dustin Wilkinson, Dan Briley, Jim "Frodo" Lybarger

content.description: Start as for Freddie Went Off the Rails, after a few feet, angle up and right past two bolts to the next small crack. Follow this crack to the top, belay with gear. To descend, go to the rap station on the west side at the top of Vertical Valium then follow the Breezeway back to the base.
content.location: On the left side of the east face, start in the Breezeway.

content.description: Climb the discontinuous crack in a shallow dihedral. Start from the sloper ledge accessed from the east end of the Breezeway or make the first few moves, 5.9, of Dustin the Wind from the very bottom of the cliff. To descend, go to the rap station on the west side at the top of Vertical Valium then follow the Breezeway back to the base.
content.location: On the left side of the east face at the mouth of the Breezeway.

climbs.name: Highlander Roof
climbs.fa: Joel Adams, Jim "Frodo" Lybarger P1- 91-92, P2- 97-98

content.description: P1 Face climb past four bolts to a small, lower angle, left-facing dihedral. The top of the dihedral turns into a small slot, climb through this and onto a nice ledge with belay bolts. 5.9, 100'   P2 At the back of the ledge, climb the wide crack past a 3/8" rivet through the roof and then up 15' of easier terrain to the top. Belay with gear. 5.8, 30'   Both pitches can easily be combined.
content.location: From the left side (the lowest) of the east face, start just left of the scrub oak that separate North Breezeway Dome and Hawk Rock and aim for the crack/chimney above.

climbs.name: Freddie Went Off the Rails
climbs.fa: Unknown, likely Joe Herbst in the late 60s-early 70s or Team Vegas in the early 90s

content.description: Climb a left leaning low-angle crack until it ends. Leave the crack (and the last opportunity for pro) and continue left on easy slab to the shoulder, then straight up the last bouldery move to the top. Belay with gear. To descend, go to the rap station on the west side at the top of Vertical Valium then follow the Breezeway back to the base.
content.protection: Stoppers, single set of cams up to 3".
content.location: The left most route on the east face, starts from the Breezeway.

content.description: Face climb straight up to the shallow "buttress" just right of the Flaky Factions dihedral, through a short section of crack, then up the left corner of the head wall. Belay with gear or leave directional and go a few feet back onto the ledge to a couple of wide spaced belay bolts. To descend, go to the rap station on the west side at the top of Vertical Valium then follow the Breezeway back to the base.
content.location: Start from the lowest point on the east face.

content.description: North Breezeway Dome is the center of the three big domes, has the highest concentration of clean rock, and forms the north side of The Breezeway. The obscure tower sprouting from the east face is Hawk Rock. There're two rappel stations, one on the northeast corner and one on the southwest. A third set of anchors is over the tallest part (130') of the east face but is too far back for lowering or pulling a rope. The oldest rappel anchor is a single 1/4" star dryven bolt with a rusted Leeper hanger by the northwest corner. Most of the climbs top out near one of the anchors but a couple will need gear.
